event.title: camped out near the location of today

data.event: Lewis and Clark Expedition camped out near the location of today's city hall.
Weston was at one time the second largest port on the Missouri river, surpassing both Kansas City and St. Joseph; however, a flood in 1881 shifted the river into an old channel some 2 miles away.
In 1850 over 265 steamboats a year docked at the Port of Weston.
